channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: WikiLeaks founder to plead guilty; What to expect at Biden-Trump debate
item.description: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has agreed to plead guilty in order to return to Australia. Plus, how immigration will feature in Biden and Trump's debate on Thursday.
item.content:encoded:
WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has agreed to plead guilty in order to return to Australia. Plus, how immigration will feature in Biden and Trump's debate on Thursday.

(Image credit: Peter Nicholls)
item.dc:creator: Majd Al-Waheidi

item.title: Kenya is sending thousands of police officers to tackle Haiti's gang violence
item.description: After a long wait and many delays the first contingent of the Kenyan-led international force is on its way to Haiti.
item.content:encoded: After a long wait and many delays the first contingent of the Kenyan-led international force is on its way to Haiti.
item.dc:creator: Emmanuel Igunza

item.title: There are signs Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s presidential campaign is struggling
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Amaryllis Fox Kennedy, Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s campaign manager and daughter-in-law, about the challenges facing Kennedy's independent presidential campaign.
item.content:encoded: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Amaryllis Fox Kennedy, Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s campaign manager and daughter-in-law, about the challenges facing Kennedy's independent presidential campaign.
item.dc:creator: A Martínez

item.title: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange enters into a plea deal with the U.S. government
item.description: Assange will plead guilty to a single charge and is expected to return to Australia. The move brings an end to a years-long international saga over his handling of national security secrets.
item.content:encoded: Assange will plead guilty to a single charge and is expected to return to Australia. The move brings an end to a years-long international saga over his handling of national security secrets.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Georgia is hosting the 1st presidential debate. Its voters could decide the election
item.description: Georgia has emerged as one of the swingiest states in politics, so it's no surprise that the first presidential debate happens there. But its voters are less excited for a repeat of the 2020 election.
item.content:encoded:
Georgia has emerged as one of the swingiest states in politics, so it's no surprise that the first presidential debate happens there. But its voters are less excited for a repeat of the 2020 election.

(Image credit: Ben Gray)
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: This time last year, Hollywood writers were on strike. Now, many can’t find work
item.description: The entertainment industry was shifting dramatically even before the strikes that paused production last year. Now, many Hollywood writers are feeling the pinch.
item.content:encoded:
The entertainment industry was shifting dramatically even before the strikes that paused production last year. Now, many Hollywood writers are feeling the pinch.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco

item.title: A second Trump term could slow the shift from fossil fuels as climate threats grow
item.description: If Donald Trump is reelected, his administration probably couldn’t stop the country’s transition away from fossil fuels. But any slowdown could have big impacts on climate change.
item.content:encoded:
If Donald Trump is reelected, his administration probably couldn’t stop the country’s transition away from fossil fuels. But any slowdown could have big impacts on climate change.

(Image credit: Ian Maule)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: The Florida Panthers bring home their team's first Stanley Cup
item.description: In Game 7 of the National Hockey League playoffs, the Florida Panthers beat the Edmonton Oilers 2-1 -- securing the team's first Stanley Cup in franchise history.
item.content:encoded: In Game 7 of the National Hockey League playoffs, the Florida Panthers beat the Edmonton Oilers 2-1 -- securing the team's first Stanley Cup in franchise history.
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: China convicts 99% of defendants in criminal trials. Reversing a conviction is hard
item.description: China is trying to reduce the number of wrongful convictions in its legal system. One man's more than two decades-long fight on death row shows why that's so difficult.
item.content:encoded: China is trying to reduce the number of wrongful convictions in its legal system. One man's more than two decades-long fight on death row shows why that's so difficult.
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Florida judge to decide whether Jack Smith's appointment is constitutional
item.description: A court hearing in Florida continues on whether special counsel Jack Smith can prosecute former President Donald Trump. Trump's lawyers argue Smith's appointment was unconstitutional.
item.content:encoded: A court hearing in Florida continues on whether special counsel Jack Smith can prosecute former President Donald Trump. Trump's lawyers argue Smith's appointment was unconstitutional.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep
